org.netbeans.api.htmlui

Class HTMLDialog.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.netbeans.api.htmlui.HTMLDialog.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    HTMLDialog

    public static final class HTMLDialog.Builder
extends Object
    Rather than using this class directly, consider HTMLDialog. The HTMLDialog annotation generates boilderplate code for you and can do some compile times checks helping you to warnings as soon as possible.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      HTMLDialog.Builder addTechIds(String... ids)
      Requests some of provided technologies.

      Obtains the component from the builder.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • newDialog

        public static HTMLDialog.Builder newDialog(String url)
        Starts creation of a new HTML dialog. The page can contain hidden buttons as described at HTMLDialog.
        Parameters:
        url - URL (usually using nbresloc protocol) of the page to display in the dialog.
        Returns:
        instance of the builder

      • loadFinished

        public HTMLDialog.Builder loadFinished(Runnable run)
        Registers a runnable to be executed when the page becomes ready.
        Parameters:
        run - runnable to run
        Returns:
        this builder

      • addTechIds

        public HTMLDialog.Builder addTechIds(String... ids)
        Requests some of provided technologies. The HTML/Java API @ version 1.1 supports technology ids. One can specify the preferred ones to use in this NetBeans component by using calling this method.
        Parameters:
        ids - list of preferred technology ids to add to the builder
        Returns:
        instance of the builder
        Since:
        1.3

      • showAndWait

        public String showAndWait()
        Displays the dialog. This method blocks waiting for the dialog to be shown and closed by the user.
        Returns:
        'id' of a selected button element or null if the dialog was closed without selecting a button

      • component

        public <C> C component(Class<C> type)
        Obtains the component from the builder. The parameter can either be JFXPanel.class or WebView.class. After calling this method the builder becomes useless.
        Type Parameters:
        C - requested component type
        Parameters:
        type - either JFXPanel or WebView class
        Returns:
        instance of the requested component
